meanings.definition: A technique in drawing where lines are crossed over each other to create shading or texture.
meanings.sent1: The artist used crosshatching to add depth to the sketch.
meanings.sent2: Crosshatching is a common method to show shadows in illustrations.
meanings.sent3: The crosshatching in the drawing made the apple look like it had stripes.
meanings.sent4: Her use of crosshatching transformed the flat image into a three-dimensional scene.
meanings.sent5: The crosshatching in the portrait made the subject's eyes appear more expressive.

meanings.definition: A pattern of lines that intersect at right angles, often used in engraving or printing.
meanings.sent1: The intricate crosshatching on the banknote made it difficult to counterfeit.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully added crosshatching to the design to give it a unique texture.
meanings.sent3: The crosshatching on the map made it look like a maze of roads and rivers.
meanings.sent4: The crosshatching on the fabric created a striking visual effect under the light.
meanings.sent5: The crosshatching on the packaging added a touch of elegance to the product.
